fact: Did You Know That Ojaina is the place where the Attah's of Igala are burried?
Did You Know That the first aircraft landed at Idah in 1955?
Did You Know That Attah Ameh Oboni, had seen to the completion of an aerodrome in 1954 at Idah?
Did you know that the Igala alphabet was adopted from the English alphabet. The latter has five (5) vowels: “a,” “e,” “i,” “o,” “u.”?
Did you know the Igala alphabet is made up of thirty-one (31) letters: some vowels, others consonants?
Did You Know That Ojaina is a restricted place only allowed for members from the Attah Ruling House?
Did you know that Ata Ameh Oboni speak fluently in Igala, Ebira & Hausa?
Did you know that the Ígálá language has seven (7) vowels: “a,” “e,” “ẹ,” “i,” “o,” “ọ,” “u” (encompassing both all the 5 English vowels and two indigenous ones, ‘ẹ’ and  ‘ọ’).?
Did You Know That Idah is also called Idah Alu Ogo Oja Abutu Eje?
Did you know that the Igala kingdom was founded by Abutu- Eje in the 7th century
Did you know that you may likely come home to meet one of your family member dead if you kill an animal at Ojaina?
Did you know that ata Ameh Oboni took his own life on the night of June 26, 1956?
Did you know that the mighty Ata Ameh Oboni died at the age of 51?
Did you know that attah Ameh Oboni schooled in Okene(Ebira Land) between 1934 and 1939? Learned in Hausa Literature
Did you know that ata Ameh Oboni started off as a market stall tax collector for Idah and Ejule market?
Did you know that Ata Obaje Ocheje moved Ameh Oboni from being a market stall tax collector to be come a cheif as onu ugwolawo due to his hard work?
Did you know that Ameh Oboni was moved to ankpa from ugwolawo as the judge, commonly known as *Wakali, to be in charge of seven districts?
Did you know that Patrick A. Okpanachi, Mallam Garba and Peter Achimugwu were the first in Igala Land that speaks and write in English Language?
Did you know that Peter Achimugwu was the man that led the campaign to remove Ameh Oboni as the Attah?
